<target_code>
Here is the code of lfs_file_sync:
```c
int lfs_file_sync(lfs_t *lfs, lfs_file_t *file) {
    int err = LFS_LOCK(lfs->cfg);
    if (err) {
        return err;
    }
    LFS_TRACE("lfs_file_sync(%p, %p)", (void*)lfs, (void*)file);
    LFS_ASSERT(lfs_mlist_isopen(lfs->mlist, (struct lfs_mlist*)file));

    err = lfs_file_sync_(lfs, file);

    LFS_TRACE("lfs_file_sync -> %d", err);
    LFS_UNLOCK(lfs->cfg);
    return err;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function lfs_file_sync:
static bool lfs_mlist_isopen(struct lfs_mlist *head,
        struct lfs_mlist *node) {
    for (struct lfs_mlist **p = &head; *p; p = &(*p)->next) {
        if (*p == (struct lfs_mlist*)node) {
            return true;
        }
    }

    return false;
}
...
static int lfs_file_sync_(lfs_t *lfs, lfs_file_t *file) {
    if (file->flags & LFS_F_ERRED) {
        // it's not safe to do anything if our file errored
        return 0;
    }

    int err = lfs_file_flush(lfs, file);
    if (err) {
        file->flags |= LFS_F_ERRED;
        return err;
    }


    if ((file->flags & LFS_F_DIRTY) &&
            !lfs_pair_isnull(file->m.pair)) {
        // before we commit metadata, we need sync the disk to make sure
        // data writes don't complete after metadata writes
        if (!(file->flags & LFS_F_INLINE)) {
            err = lfs_bd_sync(lfs, &lfs->pcache, &lfs->rcache, false);
            if (err) {
                return err;
            }
        }

        // update dir entry
        uint16_t type;
        const void *buffer;
        lfs_size_t size;
        struct lfs_ctz ctz;
        if (file->flags & LFS_F_INLINE) {
            // inline the whole file
            type = LFS_TYPE_INLINESTRUCT;
            buffer = file->cache.buffer;
            size = file->ctz.size;
        } else {
            // update the ctz reference
            type = LFS_TYPE_CTZSTRUCT;
            // copy ctz so alloc will work during a relocate
            ctz = file->ctz;
            lfs_ctz_tole32(&ctz);
            buffer = &ctz;
            size = sizeof(ctz);
        }

        // commit file data and attributes
        err = lfs_dir_commit(lfs, &file->m, LFS_MKATTRS(
                {LFS_MKTAG(type, file->id, size), buffer},
                {LFS_MKTAG(LFS_FROM_USERATTRS, file->id,
                    file->cfg->attr_count), file->cfg->attrs}));
        if (err) {
            file->flags |= LFS_F_ERRED;
            return err;
        }

        file->flags &= ~LFS_F_DIRTY;
    }

    return 0;
}
...
static int lfs_file_flush(lfs_t *lfs, lfs_file_t *file) {
    if (file->flags & LFS_F_READING) {
        if (!(file->flags & LFS_F_INLINE)) {
            lfs_cache_drop(lfs, &file->cache);
        }
        file->flags &= ~LFS_F_READING;
    }

#ifndef LFS_READONLY
    if (file->flags & LFS_F_WRITING) {
        lfs_off_t pos = file->pos;

        if (!(file->flags & LFS_F_INLINE)) {
            // copy over anything after current branch
            lfs_file_t orig = {
                .ctz.head = file->ctz.head,
                .ctz.size = file->ctz.size,
                .flags = LFS_O_RDONLY,
                .pos = file->pos,
                .cache = lfs->rcache,
            };
            lfs_cache_drop(lfs, &lfs->rcache);

            while (file->pos < file->ctz.size) {
                // copy over a byte at a time, leave it up to caching
                // to make this efficient
                uint8_t data;
                lfs_ssize_t res = lfs_file_flushedread(lfs, &orig, &data, 1);
                if (res < 0) {
                    return res;
                }

                res = lfs_file_flushedwrite(lfs, file, &data, 1);
                if (res < 0) {
                    return res;
                }

                // keep our reference to the rcache in sync
                if (lfs->rcache.block != LFS_BLOCK_NULL) {
                    lfs_cache_drop(lfs, &orig.cache);
                    lfs_cache_drop(lfs, &lfs->rcache);
                }
            }

            // write out what we have
            while (true) {
                int err = lfs_bd_flush(lfs, &file->cache, &lfs->rcache, true);
                if (err) {
                    if (err == LFS_ERR_CORRUPT) {
                        goto relocate;
                    }
                    return err;
                }

                break;

relocate:
                LFS_DEBUG("Bad block at 0x%"PRIx32, file->block);
                err = lfs_file_relocate(lfs, file);
                if (err) {
                    return err;
                }
            }
        } else {
            file->pos = lfs_max(file->pos, file->ctz.size);
        }

        // actual file updates
        file->ctz.head = file->block;
        file->ctz.size = file->pos;
        file->flags &= ~LFS_F_WRITING;
        file->flags |= LFS_F_DIRTY;

        file->pos = pos;
    }
#endif

    return 0;
}
...
static inline bool lfs_pair_isnull(const lfs_block_t pair[2]) {
    return pair[0] == LFS_BLOCK_NULL || pair[1] == LFS_BLOCK_NULL;
}
...
static int lfs_bd_sync(lfs_t *lfs,
        lfs_cache_t *pcache, lfs_cache_t *rcache, bool validate) {
    lfs_cache_drop(lfs, rcache);

    int err = lfs_bd_flush(lfs, pcache, rcache, validate);
    if (err) {
        return err;
    }

    err = lfs->cfg->sync(lfs->cfg);
    LFS_ASSERT(err <= 0);
    return err;
}
...
static void lfs_ctz_tole32(struct lfs_ctz *ctz) {
    ctz->head = lfs_tole32(ctz->head);
    ctz->size = lfs_tole32(ctz->size);
}
...
static int lfs_dir_commit(lfs_t *lfs, lfs_mdir_t *dir,
        const struct lfs_mattr *attrs, int attrcount) {
    int orphans = lfs_dir_orphaningcommit(lfs, dir, attrs, attrcount);
    if (orphans < 0) {
        return orphans;
    }

    if (orphans) {
        // make sure we've removed all orphans, this is a noop if there
        // are none, but if we had nested blocks failures we may have
        // created some
        int err = lfs_fs_deorphan(lfs, false);
        if (err) {
            return err;
        }
    }

    return 0;
}
...
static int lfs_file_close_(lfs_t *lfs, lfs_file_t *file) {
#ifndef LFS_READONLY
    int err = lfs_file_sync_(lfs, file);
#else
    int err = 0;
#endif

    // remove from list of mdirs
    lfs_mlist_remove(lfs, (struct lfs_mlist*)file);

    // clean up memory
    if (!file->cfg->buffer) {
        lfs_free(file->cache.buffer);
    }

    return err;
}

explanation:
The selected fragments contain calls between higher-level file operations (lfs_file_sync -> lfs_file_sync_, lfs_file_sync_ -> lfs_file_flush / lfs_bd_sync / lfs_dir_commit, lfs_file_close_ -> lfs_file_sync_) and other operations that may transitively invoke back into file-level operations; these call-sites are the plausible locations for indirect recursion and therefore should be investigated.

Fragments not selected and why they need not be investigated here:
- lfs_mlist_isopen: simple list traversal that does not call any file-level operations; it cannot cause recursion to lfs_file_sync/_ or lfs_file_close_.
- lfs_pair_isnull: an inline utility that only tests block values, no function calls that could create recursion.
- lfs_ctz_tole32: simple endianness conversion function performing only assignments and calls to lfs_tole32; it has no calls to file-level API and cannot participate in recursion involving lfs_file_sync/_.

Note: functions not present in the provided snippets (e.g. lfs_dir_orphaningcommit, lfs_fs_deorphan, lfs_bd_flush, lfs_file_relocate, lfs_file_flushedread/ write, or the user-provided cfg->sync) are not included as fragments because their definitions were not provided. They should be inspected separately because they could form indirect call cycles back to lfs_file_sync or lfs_file_sync_. The flagged fragments identify the call-sites where such cycles could originate and therefore are the primary places to check for indirect recursion.
